1 from typing import Optional
2 
3 import cv2
4 import numpy as np
5 
6 from .enums import ColorThreshold, ObjectColor, Color2Threshold
7 
8 
9 def hsv_threshold(img: np.ndarray, color_threshold: ColorThreshold, dst: Optional[np.ndarray] = None) -> np.ndarray:
10  """
11  Take a BGR image and return a mask of the image with pixels that are in the range of the color_threshold
12  Pixel will worth 1 if a pixel has a value between min_v and max_v for all channels
13 
14  :param img: image BGR if rgb_space = False
15  :param color_threshold: The color threshold to use to filter the image
16  :param dst: The destination image. If not None, the output will be written inside
17  :return: threshold image
18  :rtype: numpy.ndarray
19  """
20  if dst is None:
21  dst = np.zeros_like(img, dtype=np.uint8)
22 
23  cv2.GaussianBlur(img, (5, 5), 0, dst=dst)
24  cv2.cvtColor(dst, cv2.COLOR_BGR2HSV, dst)
25 
26  mask = np.zeros_like(dst, shape=(*dst.shape[0:2], 1), dtype=np.uint8)
27  for low_thresh, high_thresh in color_threshold.value:
28  cv2.bitwise_or(mask, cv2.inRange(dst, low_thresh, high_thresh), dst=mask)
29 
30  # "opening followed by closing". It allows to remove small noises and fill small holes
31  kernel = np.ones((3, 3), np.uint8)
32  cv2.erode(mask, kernel, dst=mask, iterations=2)
33  cv2.dilate(mask, kernel, dst=mask, iterations=2)
34  return mask
35 
36 
37 def filter_channel(img: np.ndarray, color: ObjectColor, dst: Optional[np.ndarray] = None) -> np.ndarray:
38  """
39  Take a BGR image and return a mask of the image with pixels that are in the range of the color_threshold
40  Everything not in the range will be set to 0 (black)
41  :param img: The image to filter
42  :param color: The color to keep
43  :param dst: The destination image. If not None, the output will be written inside
44  :return: The converted image
45  """
46  return cv2.bitwise_and(img, img, mask=hsv_threshold(img, Color2Threshold[color]), dst=dst)
47 
48 
49 def most_present_color(img: np.ndarray, x: float, y: float, sample_size: int = 3) -> ObjectColor:
50  """
51  Get the most present color in a small area around the center of the object
52  :param img: The image to process
53  :param x: The x coordinate of the center of the object
54  :param y: The y coordinate of the center of the object
55  :param sample_size: The size of the area to sample
56  :return: The most present color in the area
57  """
58  x_int = int(x)
59  y_int = int(y)
60  colors_representation = np.mean(img[y_int - sample_size:y_int + sample_size,
61  x_int - sample_size:x_int + sample_size],
62  axis=(0, 1))
63  most_present_channel = np.argmax(colors_representation)
64  return ObjectColor(most_present_channel)
